1.SceneDescription: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is getting ready for her first day.

lines.Line:
(running in from her bedroom, wearing only a towel) Okay. Hey. Umm. Does
everybody hate these shoes?

Oh yeah, but don't worry. I don't think anybody's gonna focus on that
as long as your wearing that towel dress.

(to Chandler) It's her first day at this new job. Your not supposed to
start with her!

Line.Line:
I need you to come to this bachelor party for my weird cousin Albert,
y'know he's the botanist.
Oh God. Y'know, botanists are such geeks.
Yeah. Is that a dinosaur tie?
Yeah. Is that a dinosaur tie?
Hmm? Oh, yeah. (he makes a growling sound)

(entering, with about 20 purses hanging around her neck) Morning. Rach,
I'm here with the purses!
(to Phoebe) It must take you forever to find your keys.
(to Phoebe) It must take you forever to find your keys.
(running into the living room) Thank you, thank you, thank you, Pheebs.
Your welcome, oh please not the one with the turtles.
No, no, no, no turtles scare me. I don't need that today.
No, no, no, no turtles scare me. I don't need that today.

Honey, just relax, it's gonna be fine. Hey, umm,. why don't I come down
there and I'll take you out to lunch?
Oh honey, thank you, but Mark's taking me out.
Mark is that ah, the same Mark that helped you get the job?
Mark is that ah, the same Mark that helped you get the job?

Yeah, it's kinda like a 'good luck on your first day' sort of thing. (to
Phoebe) Is this actually a lunchbox?
Umm, no, it's a purse. And there's a thermos in it.
(to Ross) Hey, so can you make it on Friday?
What? Oh yeah, yeah I think so. Why am I invited to this again?

Well apparently Albert has no friends. He's very excited about the
bachelor party though. I think actually the only reason he's getting married is so he can
see a stripper.

A stripper at a bachelor party, that is so cliché. Why don't you get a
magician?!

Well, if the magician can open my beer with his but cheeks, then all
right.

Well, if the magician can open my beer with his but cheeks, then all
right.

2.SceneDescription: Rachel's office, Mark is training Rachel.

lines.Line:
...and the style number, and the invoice number, and the shipping date.
Good. Any questions so far?
Yeah. What kind of discount do we get?
Oh!! I love this job! (her phone rings) Wow! My first call.
Here, let me. (answers phone) Rachel Green's line, how may I help you?
And who may I say is calling?
And who may I say is calling?
Hi! What's ah, what's Mark doing answering your phone?

Ohhhhh yeah, that's, that's funny. Why ah, why isn't he goofing around in
his own office?

Oh honey, this is his office too. I told you we're Joanna's two
assistants.
Why does Joanna need two assistants, how, how lazy is she?
Why does Joanna need two assistants, how, how lazy is she?
Oh! Oh my God! What did I just do?

I think I just shipped 3,000 bras to personnel. Oh honey, I gotta go.
(to Mark) Mark, I need you!
Okay, bye-bye. (starts slamming the receiver down in anger.)

Oh, oh, I'm, I'm, I'm sorry sweetie, I was just trying to ah, I'm dialing
another number. (hangs up)

(singing) You've got to pick a pocket or two. Boyyyyssss, (picks a
handkerchief from the pianist's pocket) you've got to pick a pocket or two..........

Listen Joey, we definitely want to see you for the callback on
Saturday.

Okay, and listen don't forget to bring your jazz shoes for the dance
audition.
Ahhh! My ah, my agent said it wasn't a dancing part.

Joey, all the roles got to dance a little. But believe me with your
dance background it'll be a piece of cake.

4.SceneDescription: Rachel's office, her desk is covered with stuff Ross has sent her.

lines.Line: (reaching through the flowers) Do you have the, the Ralph Lauren file?

Oh, yeah, sure, it's umm... (she picks up this bug and it starts to play
the theme from Love Story)
It's from Ross, it's a love bug.
Wow! Somebody wants people to know you have a boyfriend.

Oh no, no-no-no, that's not, not, not, what he is doing. He's just, he's
just really romantic.
(to Rachel) Ah, excuse me, are you Rachel Green?
(to Rachel) Ah, excuse me, are you Rachel Green?
(being joined by the rest of the barbershop quartet) One, two, three...

(singing) Congratulations on your first week at your brand new job! It
won't be long before your the boss.

(singing) And you know who will be there to support... you?! Your one
and only boyfriend...
It's nice to have a boyfriend.
It's nice to have a boyfriend.
Your loyal loving boyfriend Ross..... Ross!

5.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Chandler, Ross, Joey are there.

lines.Line: Why?! How?! How is he a genius?

Look, don't you see what's happening here. Instead of hitting on her
right away, he's becoming her confidant. Now he's gonna be the guy she goes too to
complain about you.
What am I going to do?
What am I going to do?
What am I going to do?

Well, why don't you send her a musical bug, op, no you already did
that. All right look, you're going to have to go there yourself now, okay, make a few
surprise visits.

All right fine, don't do anything, just sit here and talk to us,
meanwhile she is talking to him about you. And he's being Mr. Joe Sensitive, and she
starts thinking 'Maybe this is the guy for me, because he understands me.'

And before you know it, she's with him. And you'll be all, 'Ohh, man!' And
he'll be all, 'Yes!' And us, we'll be like, 'Wh-whoa, dude.' And pretty soon you'll be
like, (sadly) 'Hhiii,' and, and, and, 'I can't go, Rachel and Mark might be there.' And
we'll be like, 'Man get over it, it's been four years!!'
He paints quite a picture doesn't he?
He paints quite a picture doesn't he?

6.SceneDescription: Joey's dance audition, Joey is warming up.

lines.Line:
Ah Joey. Joey Tribbiani. Listen Joey, I got a problem, I just got a
call from my dance captain, he's having a relationship crisis and can't get out of Long
Island.
So, does that mean the audition is off?

Listen Joey, seeing as you've got the most experience, I want you to
take these dancers and show them the combination.

Aw come on Joey, it's easy. Y'know, it's hand, hand, head, head, (very
quickly, Joey watches stunned) up, pas de bouree, pas de bouree, big turn here, grand
sissone, sissone, sissone, slide back, step, step, step, and jazz hands!
It's ah, step-ity, step and jazz hands.
It's ah, step-ity, step and jazz hands.
(to Julio) So! I'm just an empty vase, huh?

Y'know, so I don't read as many important books as you do, and I don't write trick poems that seem to be about one thing but are actually about something else. And y'know what, I get excited about stupid stuff, like when I my People magazine comes on Saturday, and the new Hold Everything catalog. Y'know but that does not mean that I'm empty, I care about things. I care about my friends and family. You have no right to make that kind of judgment about me.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, the poem is not about you.

The Empty Vase is not about you. My baby, you make me so sad that you
would think this.
No, it's about all women. Well, all American women. You feel better now?

8.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Chandler and Rachel are there.

lines.Line: So ah, did you have fun at the bachelor party last night?

Oh yeah, yeah! Look what I got, look what I got. (holds up a pen) See,
she's fully dressed, right?

And then you click it and, uh-oh, she's naked. And then, and then you
click it again and she's dressed. She's a business woman, she's walking down the street,
she's window shopping, and (clicks pen) whoa-whoa-whoa, sh-she's naked! (Rachel just
stares at him.)
Y'know what, I'm, I'm gonna spend some alone time with the pen.
(sits down next to her) I'm sorry, I was an idiot.

A big idiot. Just you have to realize is, this whole Mark thing is kinda
hard for me.
Gunther is eavesdropping in the background.)

Line.Line:
Well, I was with Carol for like eight years and I lost her. And now if
it's possible I think I love you even more. So, it's hard for me to believe that I'm not
gonna, well that someone else is not going to take you away.
Let it be me! Let it be me!
Let it be me! Let it be me!
Let it be me! Let it be me!

Honey, that's very sweet, it just seems to me though, that if two people
love each other and trust each other, like we do, there's no reason to be jealous. (she
kisses him)
I gotta get going. Bye Chandler.
I gotta get going. Bye Chandler.

Oh, okay Ross. Listen, this pen is kinda getting boring, so can you
pick me up some porn?
Oh, I've got to go pick up Ben, we've got a play date this afternoon.
Oh, just this woman that I met last night at the party.
There was a woman at the... (realizes) The stripper?!
You have a play date with a stripper?!
Man, I gotta get a kid. (looks at the pen and starts laughing)

Ah, yeah, yeah. Umm, we started talking after she y'know, did her thing.
And it turns out she's got a boy about Ben's age, so we're taking them to a gym-boree
class. Why, is that okay?
Oh. (starts shaking the sugar down in a packet really hard.)

Noo, I y'know I don't see why she has to play with you, that's all. I
mean doesn't she have any y'know other stripper moms friends of her own?

I'm not jealous. All right this is about, umm, people feeling certain
things y'know about strippers. And y'know, and um, I...

Line.Character: (She runs over and gives him a very passionate kiss.
Line.Line: She runs over and gives him a very passionate kiss.)

(to Chandler) Well, there's a kiss that he won't forget for a couple of
hours, y'know.

Yeah. Either that, or you just turned him on and sent him off to a
stripper.
